thread.section_title: Lady Gaga Pictures, Songs, Videos and Album Updates | Daily Mail Online
thread.title: set to guest judge RuPaul's Drag Race premiere
thread.title_full: Lady Gaga set to guest judge RuPaul's Drag Race premiere | Daily Mail Online

author: Kelby Vera At Dailymail.com
title: set to guest judge RuPaul's Drag Race premiere
text:
People are clamoring to have a piece of Lady Gaga following her top-notch Super Bowl performance at Sunday's game.
And on Tuesday, the 30-year-old singer announced she'll join RuPaul's Drag Race as a guest judge on the show's season premiere.
Gaga announced her upcoming appearance in a tweet where she also teased fans with a clip of her guest role.
Scroll down for video
Off to the races! Lady Gaga announced she'll be a guest judge on the season premiere of RuPaul's Drag Race
The queen: Drag icon RuPaul has been hosting Drag Race for eight seasons, with number nine set to begin in March
It looks like the Perfect Illusion singer pulled out all the stops for her appearance.
In the clip you can see Gaga sport over-the-top eye makeup and extreme shoulder pads as she tells the contestants 'May the best woman win.'
In the tweet the star also included the hashtags '#DontBeADrag' and '#JustBeAQueen', referencing lyrics from her hit Born This Way.
Don't be a drag! Gaga seems like a perfect fit for the hit Logo TV show because of her daring style and over-the-top attitude
It seems surprising that the fanciful star hasn't made an appearance on the hit Logo show already.
Her explosive style and one-of-a-kind attitude make her seem like a perfect fit for Drag Race.
Over the years RuPaul and company have welcomed the likes of A-listers Gigi Hadid, fashion designer Marc Jacobs and many more to to guest judge the fabulous competition.
Hot pink! Brooklyn Drag Queen Sasha Velour is set to compete is season nine of RuPaul's Drag Race
She's fresh! Chicago based talent Peppermint will also compete for the title of America's Next Drag Superstar
The competition was proud to announce its season nine contestants last Thursday.
Queens by the name of Peppermint, Sasha Velour, Farrah Moan and more will compete for the title of America's Next Drag Superstar.
The show's ninth season premieres early March, with the final release date yet to be confirmed.
